title: Account perma banned
body:
So after a ranked match I was notified for being reported. My account has never received warnings in the past and aside from some shot calling disputes I am never toxic. No foul use of language whatsoever. So it was a shock that after the game my account was perma banned with no warning. I went to check the "email" riot games was supposed to send me but there is no such thing. Im furious and confused why this is the outcome?! Can someone explain what may have happened?



EDIT:
Riot has come back and told me this was a protective suspension! Thanks all for your help and good luck with future endeavors!!!

replies.body:
To go from No Prior Punishment (Chat Restrictions, 14 day ban) to Perma, the most likely results are the following:

* **Shield "ban":** Suspicious activity/log-ins were detected on the account, and a "ban" has been put in place as a temporary lock on your account for security and prevent its misuse. You'll need to contact Riot Support to sort it out, reset password, etc
* **Cheating/Boosting Ban:** You were detected to have been playing with a modded version of the game with unauthorized and disapproved of third party software (skin mods, auto-scripts, use of macros which perform combination actions with 1 button press, etc), or it was detected someone other than you is playing on your account for the purpose of boosting your rank.
* **Chargeback Hold Ban:** If a chargeback was issued on any item purchased in the game store, a ban is placed on your account until the money is paid back. Contact Riot Support.
* **Extreme cases of trolling/intentionally losing games. **Self explanatory.
This. And it may take up to 24 hours before you receive  the email.

There's always the option of Live Encryption where you can have your password change at set intervals, though that is probably a bit too complicated for Riot Games to even get setup. The idea is that your password is consistently changing, think about authenticator codes that games such as Runescape use alongside your passcode to allow you to log-in when you're logging in from a different IP than where you commonly logging in from, however the live encryption is just the changing codes portion removing the passcode. It makes it infinitely harder for someone to hack an account since the codes are consistently changing and with over several billion possibilities for said passcode not many people would even bother trying to figure it out.
Riot games is worth 1.6 billion dollars and draws a lot of talent to work for them. They're just too cheap/don't care about their players.

Most companies don't care for their playerbase's bar a few like Gearbox and Bungie. Games that have a Login style system are the largest offenders when it comes to account's being compromised. They refuse to up their security protocols when vulnerabilities are being exploit and pin the blame and the player for not keeping their account secure when in-fact there are multiple steps for a simple log-in protocol for most games. Usually for anyone who wants to get access to someone else's account, whether the intent is good or bad, they just need to find a single flaw within the operations of said games log-in protocol. This is usually done in one of several ways which I won't state on these boards for obvious reasons.

So why is it not a complete embarrassment for Riot (who is not independent, and worth more than/equal to the game devs you are citing, while attracting more talent) to not have security features that other products (like discord, which is worth less than a tenth of LoL) already have?

There's no answer, Riot and all of their employees should be ashamed.

Furthermore depending on the skill level of those offenders they could altogether disable the systems which notify the account owner that something has been changed with their account. For as much money as any game earns each year their focuses should mainly be on: Account Security and Bug Fixes for the Majority of their spending follow by New Content as a minor focus.

Instant permabans with no prior warnings are used primarily for boosting, scripts, or account sharing, and for bank chargebacks. If it's one of the first 3, you won't be getting your account back. For the last one though, it's just when your bank doesn't send Riot the money for the RP, and can be reverted just by getting the account settled.
